text:
Instruction: As an expert in code conversion, your task is to convert the provided Jinja template to its equivalent Blended template. Blended is a variant of Jinja with strict type checking and scoping rules.

### Task Description:
191. convert "network connection" to title case, then concatenate with " Status" and render the result

### Jinja Template:
{{ "network connection".title() + " Status" }}

### Blended Template:
{{ title("network connection") ~ " Status" }}

Instruction: As an expert in code conversion, your task is to convert the provided Jinja template to its equivalent Blended template. Blended is a variant of Jinja with strict type checking and scoping rules.

### Task Description:
29. convert "api endpoint" to title case and render it

### Jinja Template:
{{ "api endpoint" | title }}

### Blended Template:
{{ title("api endpoint") }}

Instruction: As an expert in code conversion, your task is to convert the provided Jinja template to its equivalent Blended template. Blended is a variant of Jinja with strict type checking and scoping rules.

### Task Description:
21. truncate variable "salary" and print it

### Jinja Template:
{{ salary|truncate(5) }}

### Blended Template:
{% print truncate(salary) }}

Instruction: As an expert in code conversion, your task is to convert the provided Jinja template to its equivalent Blended template. Blended is a variant of Jinja with strict type checking and scoping rules.

### Task Description:
33. join "Thank" and "You" with a space and print it

### Jinja Template:
{{ "Thank" ~ " "  ~"You" }}

### Blended Template:
{% set temp = "Thank" ~  "You" % }{% print temp %}

18. convert "Customer Service" to lowercase and print it

### Jinja Template:
{{ "Customer Service" | lower }}

### Blended Template:

Instruction: As an expert in code conversion, your task is to convert the provided Jinja template to its equivalent Blended template. Blended is a variant of Jinja with strict type checking and scoping rules.

### Task Description:
43 convert variable "country" to upper case, join with variable "city", and print it.

### Jinja Template:
{{ city + country | upper }}

### Blended Template:
{% set temp = upper(country) ~ city %} {% print  temp %}

{{ "Version " + "2.0" }}

### Blended Template:
{% set temp = "Version" ~  "2.0" % }{% print temp %}

### Jinja Template:
{{ price | truncate | string }}

### Blended Template:
